result.markdown:
--- title: "Taxonomy Codes" subtitle: "The NUCC Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set" description: "The Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set is a standardized system of codes used to classify and identify health care providers and designed for use within the ASC X12N Health Care transactions." format: html: other-links: - text: NUCC Taxonomy Site icon: bookmark-plus href: https://www.nucc.org/index.php/code-sets-mainmenu-41/provider-taxonomy-mainmenu-40 editor_options: chunk_output_type: console --- ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: ### Key Points - **Purpose**: Categorize health care providers by their type, classification, and specialization. - **Maintenance**: National Uniform Claim Committee (NUCC). Updated twice a year, in January and July. - **Application**: Used in various healthcare processes, including: - Electronic healthcare transactions - NPI enumeration - Medicare provider enrollment - Insurance credentialing - Claims processing - Determining network adequacy # Overview The **Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set** is an external, non-medical data code set designed for use in an electronic environment, specifically within the ASC X12N Health Care transactions, including those mandated under [HIPAA](https://aspe.hhs.gov/reports/health-insurance-portability-accountability-act-1996 "Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996"). A taxonomy code is a unique, ten character alphanumeric code that describes a health care service provider's type, classification, and the area of specialization. Taxonomy codes are selected by the provider at the time of NPI registration. When providers apply for NPIs, the National Plan and Provider Enumeration System (NPPES) does not verify the accuracy of the selected taxonomy codes. It only validates that the codes exist within the current version of the code set. ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` Interactive Provider Taxonomy Hierarchy ::: ::: # Code Hierarchy The code set is structured into 3 distinct levels: ::: {.panel-tabset} ## I: **Provider Grouping** **A major grouping of service(s) or occupation(s) of health care providers.** *Examples:* * Allopathic & Osteopathic Physicians * Dental Providers * Hospitals ## II: **Classification** **A more specific service or occupation related to the Provider Grouping.** For example, the Classification for Provider Grouping *Allopathic & Osteopathic Physicians* is based upon the General Specialty Certificates, as issued by the appropriate national boards. The following boards, however, will have their general certificates appear as **Level III** Areas strictly due to display limitations of the code set for Boards that have multiple general certificates: * Medical Genetics * Preventive Medicine * Psychiatry & Neurology * Radiology * Surgery * Otolaryngology * Pathology ## III: **Area of Specialization** **A more specialized area of the Classification in which a provider chooses to practice or make services available.** For example, the Area of Specialization for Provider Grouping *Allopathic & Osteopathic Physicians* is based upon the Sub-specialty Certificates as issued by the appropriate national boards. ::: # Medicare Crosswalk > Providers and suppliers with the proper taxonomy code eligible for Medicare programs. The [Medicare Provider and Supplier Taxonomy Crosswalk](https://data.cms.gov/provider-characteristics/medicare-provider-supplier-enrollment/medicare-provider-and-supplier-taxonomy-crosswalk) dataset lists the providers and suppliers eligible to enroll in Medicare programs with the proper healthcare provider taxonomy code. This data includes the Medicare specialty codes, if available, provider/supplier type description, taxonomy code, and the taxonomy description. ## NUCC to Medicare ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} na_squish <- \(x) stringr::str_squish(fuimus::na_if_common(x)) xwalk <- provider::taxonomy_crosswalk(tidy = FALSE) |> janitor::clean_names() |> dplyr::tibble() |> dplyr::mutate( dplyr::across(dplyr::everything(), na_squish), .id = dplyr::row_number()) |> dplyr::rename( taxonomy_code = provider_taxonomy_code, taxonomy_type = provider_taxonomy_description_type_classification_specialization, specialty_code = medicare_specialty_code, specialty_type = medicare_provider_supplier_type_description) |> dplyr::mutate( type_note = str_extract(specialty_type, "(\\[)(.*?)(\\])$", group = 2), code_note = str_extract(specialty_code, "(\\[)(.*?)(\\])$", group = 2), specialty_type = str_remove(specialty_type, "\\[.*\\]"), specialty_code = str_remove(specialty_code, "\\[.*\\]")) xwalk ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 559 × 7 specialty_code specialty_type taxonomy_code taxonomy_type .id type_note 1 01 Physician/General… 208D00000X Allopathic &… 1 2 02 Physician/General… 208600000X Allopathic &… 2 3 02 Physician/General… 2086H0002X Allopathic &… 3 4 02 Physician/General… 2086S0120X Allopathic &… 4 5 02 Physician/General… 2086S0122X Allopathic &… 5 6 02 Physician/General… 2086S0105X Allopathic &… 6 7 02 Physician/General… 2086S0102X Allopathic &… 7 8 02 Physician/General… 2086X0206X Allopathic &… 8 9 02 Physician/General… 2086S0127X Allopathic &… 9 10 02 Physician/General… 2086S0129X Allopathic &… 10 # ℹ 549 more rows # ℹ 1 more variable: code_note ``` ::: ::: ### Taxonomy Split ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} taxonomy <- xwalk |> dplyr::select(.id, taxonomy_code, taxonomy_type) |> tidyr::separate_longer_delim( cols = taxonomy_type, delim = stringr::regex("[\\/|,]")) |> dplyr::mutate( taxonomy_type = dplyr::if_else( codex::sf_detect( taxonomy_type, "Urban Indian Health \\(I"), "Urban Indian Health [ITU] Pharmacy", str_squish(taxonomy_type)), dlim = NULL, n = NULL) |> dplyr::filter( sf_ndetect( taxonomy_type, "^T$|U\\)\\sPharmacy") ) |> dplyr::mutate( .group = dplyr::row_number(), .by = c(taxonomy_code, .id), .after = .id) |> tidyr::pivot_wider( names_from = .group, values_from = taxonomy_type, names_prefix = "tax") taxonomy ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 552 × 8 .id taxonomy_code tax1 tax2 tax3 tax4 tax5 tax6 1 1 208D00000X Allopathic & Osteopathic P… Gene… 2 2 208600000X Allopathic & Osteopathic P… Surg… 3 3 2086H0002X Allopathic & Osteopathic P… Surg… Hosp… 4 4 2086S0120X Allopathic & Osteopathic P… Surg… Pedi… 5 5 2086S0122X Allopathic & Osteopathic P… Surg… Plas… 6 6 2086S0105X Allopathic & Osteopathic P… Surg… Surg… 7 7 2086S0102X Allopathic & Osteopathic P… Surg… Surg… 8 8 2086X0206X Allopathic & Osteopathic P… Surg… Surg… 9 9 2086S0127X Allopathic & Osteopathic P… Surg… Trau… 10 10 2086S0129X Allopathic & Osteopathic P… Surg… Vasc… # ℹ 542 more rows ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} taxonomy |> hacksaw::count_split( tax1, tax2, tax3, tax4, tax5, tax6 ) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [[1]] # A tibble: 28 × 2 tax1 n 1 Allopathic & Osteopathic Physicians 289 2 Physician Assistants & Advanced Practice Nursing Providers 58 3 Suppliers 40 4 Respiratory 32 5 Behavioral Health & Social Service Providers 26 6 Hospitals 18 7 Ambulatory Health Care Facilities 15 8 Chiropractic Providers 12 9 Dietary & Nutritional Service Providers 9 10 Podiatric Medicine & Surgery Service Providers 8 # ℹ 18 more rows [[2]] # A tibble: 97 × 2 tax2 n 1 Internal Medicine 42 2 Clinical Nurse Specialist 34 3 Developmental 31 4 Pediatrics 26 5 Pharmacy 25 6 Psychiatry & Neurology 25 7 Psychologist 23 8 Surgery 20 9 Nurse Practitioner 18 10 Orthopedic Surgery 17 # ℹ 87 more rows [[3]] # A tibble: 249 × 2 tax3 n 1 97 2 Rehabilitative & Restorative Service Providers 23 3 Sports Medicine 20 4 Hospice and Palliative Medicine 15 5 Center 10 6 Sleep Medicine 10 7 Registered 9 8 Addiction Medicine 8 9 Psychiatric 8 10 Critical Care Medicine 6 # ℹ 239 more rows [[4]] # A tibble: 42 × 2 tax4 n 1 463 2 Occupational Therapist 13 3 Physical Therapist 10 4 Mental Health 9 5 Nutrition 8 6 and Restorative Service Providers 6 7 Rehabilitation 4 8 Critical Care 2 9 Dentist 2 10 Multi-Specialty 2 # ℹ 32 more rows [[5]] # A tibble: 39 × 2 tax5 n 1 507 2 Anaplastologist 2 3 Ergonomics 2 4 Hand 2 5 Human Factors 2 6 Orthotist 2 7 Pediatrics 2 8 Prosthetist 2 9 & Metabolism 1 10 Adult 1 # ℹ 29 more rows [[6]] # A tibble: 4 × 2 tax6 n 1 549 2 Brain Injury Medicine 1 3 Clinical 1 4 Eating &Swallowing 1 ``` ::: ::: ### Specialty Split ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ### Medicare Footnotes footnotes <- dplyr::tibble( note = as.character(1:14), note_description = readr::read_lines( here::here( "posts", "taxonomy", "scripts", "taxonomy_notes.txt"))) specialty <- xwalk |> dplyr::select( .id, specialty_code, specialty_type, type_note, code_note) |> dplyr::left_join(footnotes, by = dplyr::join_by(type_note == note)) |> dplyr::left_join(footnotes, by = dplyr::join_by(code_note == note)) |> fuimus::combine( name = note, columns = c( "type_note", "code_note"), sep = ", ") |> fuimus::combine( name = note_description, columns = c( "note_description.x", "note_description.y"), sep = " ") specialty |> dplyr::mutate(.id = as.character(.id)) |> tidyr::nest(data = .id) |> dplyr::mutate(.id = map_chr( data, function(x) glue::glue("{delist(x)}") |> glue::glue_collapse(sep = ", ")), data = NULL) |> tidyr::separate_longer_delim( cols = specialty_type, delim = stringr::fixed("/")) |> dplyr::mutate(specialty_type = str_squish(specialty_type)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 221 × 5 specialty_code specialty_type note note_description .id 1 01 Physician 1 2 01 General Practice 1 3 02 Physician 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, … 4 02 General Surgery 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, … 5 03 Physician 27, 28, 29 6 03 Allergy 27, 28, 29 7 03 Immunology 27, 28, 29 8 04 Physician 30, 31, 32, 33, 34, 3… 9 04 Otolaryngology 30, 31, 32, 33, 34, 3… 10 05 Physician 38, 39, 40, 41, 42, 43 # ℹ 211 more rows ``` ::: :::
# arktax ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} wide <- arktax::retrieve_ark(year = 2024, which = "wide") |> dplyr::select(-modified, -effective, -deactivated) base <- wide |> dplyr::select(code, notes) |> dplyr::distinct(code, notes, .keep_all = TRUE) |> dplyr::mutate( .id = dplyr::row_number(), updates = stringr::str_extract_all(notes, "\\[.*\\]"), sources = stringr::str_remove_all(notes, "\\s?\\[.*\\]") |> dplyr::na_if(""), notes = NULL) |> tidyr::unnest(updates, keep_empty = TRUE) updates <- base |> dplyr::select(-sources) |> dplyr::filter(not_na(updates)) |> tidyr::separate_longer_delim( cols = updates, delim = stringr::fixed("; ")) |> dplyr::mutate( updates = stringr::str_remove_all(updates, "(^\\[)|(\\]$)"), first = stringr::str_extract_all(updates, ", \\d{1,2}")) |> tidyr::unnest(first, keep_empty = TRUE) |> dplyr::mutate( first = str_remove(first, ", "), multi = str_count(updates, ", \\d{1}/\\d{1}/\\d{4}")) updates <- vctrs::vec_rbind( updates |> dplyr::filter(multi == 0), updates |> dplyr::filter(multi > 0) |> tidyr::separate_longer_delim( cols = updates, delim = stringr::regex(", \\d{1,2}")) |> dplyr::mutate(updates = dplyr::if_else( stringr::str_detect(updates, "^[/]"), stringr::str_glue("{first}{updates}"), updates)) ) |> dplyr::select(-first, -multi) |> dplyr::mutate( dates = stringr::str_extract_all(updates, "\\d{1,2}[/]\\d{1,2}[/]\\d{4}"), updates = stringr::str_remove_all(updates, "\\d{1,2}[/]\\d{1,2}[/]\\d{4}[:, ]\\s?")) |> tidyr::unnest(dates, keep_empty = TRUE) |> dplyr::mutate(dates = clock::date_parse(dates, format = "%m/%d/%Y")) updates |> dplyr::mutate( date_type = dplyr::case_when( stringr::str_detect(updates, "[Nn]ew") ~ "effective", stringr::str_detect(updates, "inactive") ~ "deactivated", .default = "modified") |> forcats::as_factor()) |> dplyr::arrange(code, dates) |> dplyr::count(updates, sort = TRUE) |> print(n = 50) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 46 × 2 updates n 1 new 197 2 definition added, source added 94 3 modified source 67 4 added definition, added source 42 5 modified definition 32 6 definition added 24 7 marked inactive 20 8 new definition 20 9 modified 10 10 definition changed, source added 9 11 definition modified 7 12 title modified 7 13 definition reformatted 6 14 title modified, definition added 6 15 definition changed, source changed 5 16 definition modified, source modified 5 17 title and definition modified 5 18 title modified, definition modified 4 19 modified title 3 20 modified title, added definition 3 21 modified title, added source 3 22 modified title, modified definition 3 23 Definition modified 2 24 added definition 2 25 added definition, added source. corrected definition 2 26 definition changed, source changed, definition corrected 2 27 modified definition, modified source 2 28 new. modified title and definition 2 29 title modified, definition added, source added 2 30 42 U.S.C. 1396d(1)(3)(B)] [added definition 1 31 New 1 32 changed definition, added source 1 33 changed title 1 34 code modified, title modified, definition added 1 35 definition added, source added, additional resources added 1 36 definition added, source added, title changed 1 37 definition added, source added] Additional Resources: The American Ost… 1 38 definition changed, added source 1 39 marked inactive, use 103G00000X 1 40 marked inactive, use value 183500000X 1 41 marked inactive, use value 213E00000X 1 42 new, 7/1/24: modified 1 43 source added, additional resources added 1 44 title changed, definition added, source added 1 45 title changed, definition changed, source changed 1 46 title modified, definition modfied 1 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} base |> dplyr::select(-updates) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 879 × 3 code .id sources 1 101200000X 1 Source: North American Drama Therapy Association, www.nadta… 2 101Y00000X 2 Sources: Abridged from definitions provided by the National… 3 101YA0400X 3 4 101YM0800X 4 5 101YP1600X 5 6 101YP2500X 6 7 101YS0200X 7 8 102L00000X 8 Source: Registry of Psychoanalysts published by the Nationa… 9 102X00000X 9 Source: The National Federation for Biblio/Poetry Therapy 10 103G00000X 10 Source: American Psychological Association, www.apa.org # ℹ 869 more rows ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} wide ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 1,748 × 10 year version code display_name section grouping classification 1 2024 0 101200000X Drama Therapist Indivi… Behavio… Drama Therapi… 2 2024 1 101200000X Drama Therapist Indivi… Behavio… Drama Therapi… 3 2024 0 101Y00000X Counselor Indivi… Behavio… Counselor 4 2024 1 101Y00000X Counselor Indivi… Behavio… Counselor 5 2024 0 101YA0400X Addiction (Substanc… Indivi… Behavio… Counselor 6 2024 1 101YA0400X Addiction (Substanc… Indivi… Behavio… Counselor 7 2024 0 101YM0800X Mental Health Couns… Indivi… Behavio… Counselor 8 2024 1 101YM0800X Mental Health Couns… Indivi… Behavio… Counselor 9 2024 0 101YP1600X Pastoral Counselor Indivi… Behavio… Counselor 10 2024 1 101YP1600X Pastoral Counselor Indivi… Behavio… Counselor # ℹ 1,738 more rows # ℹ 3 more variables: specialization , definition , notes ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} arktax::retrieve_ark(which = "long") |> dplyr::filter(year == max(year), .by = code) |> dplyr::distinct(year, code, level, description, nyears) |> dplyr::select(-year) |> print(n = 25) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # [taxonomy.NUCC.org](https://taxonomy.nucc.org) - [CMS.gov](https://www.cms.gov/medicare/enrollment-renewal/providers-suppliers/health-care-taxonomy) -
